intro: Amphipogon confusus, commonly known as the confused amphipogon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
